definition: falling intonation (linguistics)/to lower the key of a tune/to demote
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to surrender/to capitulate/to subdue/to tame
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: Notice the falling intonation of the doctor's Wh-questions.
sentences.chinese: 注意醫生提的特殊疑問句都用降調。

sentences.english: He always speaks with a falling intonation .
Here we should use an fwisling tone.
Listen to these sentences spoken first with rising and then with falling intonation.
sentences.chinese: 聽以下的先是升調然後是降調的句子。

sentences.english: Here we should use a falling tone.
We use the falling tone when we read special questions.
sentences.chinese: 讀特殊疑問句的時候用降調。

definition: nonsyllabic final r 儿 added to a word in spoken Chinese/also called retroflex final or r-ization
to focus
Personal Handy-phone System (PHS), mobile network system operating in China 1998-2013, branded "Little Smart"
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: foolish talk/nonsense
irrelevant/beside the point
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: female gossip/busybody
see 噼裡啪啦|噼里啪啦[pi1 li5 pa1 la1]
to clip (an image)/image clipping
mahjong tile
to repair a tire
shouting abuse in the street like a fishwife
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
pampered and spoiled since childhood
